Rest API documentation¶

Users management controller¶

app.routers.users.users.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService), jwt_manager: JWTManager = Depends(JWTManager))[source]¶

Confirm a user’s email using a token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

  • jwt_manager (JWTManager) – The JWT manager for validating the token.

Returns:

A success message if the email is confirmed.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user is not found.

app.routers.users.users.me(request: Request, current_user: UserResponse = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Retrieve the current authenticated user’s details.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • current_user (schemas.UserResponse) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The details of the current user.

Return type:

schemas.UserResponse

app.routers.users.users.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService))[source]¶

Request an email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The email address of the user requesting confirmation.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending the confirmation email.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

A success message indicating the confirmation email was sent.

Return type:

dict

app.routers.users.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), upload_service: UploadFileService = Depends(UploadFileService), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_admin_user))[source]¶

Update the avatar for the current user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded avatar file.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • upload_service (UploadFileService) – The service for handling file uploads.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated admin user.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

schemas.UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the file upload or database update fails.

Contacts interaction controller¶

app.routers.contacts.contacts.contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[schemas.Contact]

app.routers.contacts.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (schemas.ContactCreate) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

schemas.Contact

app.routers.contacts.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Delete a specific contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

schemas.Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

app.routers.contacts.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The requested contact.

Return type:

schemas.Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

app.routers.contacts.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of records to skip (default: 0).

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of records to return (default: 10).

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[schemas.Contact]

app.routers.contacts.contacts.search_contacts(name: str | None = None, lastname: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Search for contacts by name, lastname, or email for the current user.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The first name to search for.

  • lastname (Optional[str]) – The last name to search for.

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email to search for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

A list of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[schemas.Contact]

app.routers.contacts.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), contact_service: ContactService = Depends(ContactService))[source]¶

Update a specific contact by ID for the current user.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (schemas.ContactUpdate) – The updated contact data.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • contact_service (ContactService) – The contact service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

schemas.Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Authentication process controller¶

app.routers.auth.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService), jwt_manager: JWTManager = Depends(JWTManager))[source]¶

Authenticate a user and generate an access token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login credentials (username and password).

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

  • jwt_manager (JWTManager) – The JWT manager for generating the access token.

Returns:

The access token and its type.

Return type:

schemas.TokenModel

Raises:

  • HTTPException – If the username is invalid.

  • HTTPException – If the password is incorrect.

  • HTTPException – If the user’s email is not confirmed.

app.routers.auth.auth.register_user(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService))[source]¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (schemas.UserModel) – The user registration data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending emails.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The registered user’s data.

Return type:

UserResponse

app.routers.auth.auth.request_password_reset(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService), jwt_manager: JWTManager = Depends(JWTManager))[source]¶

Handle a password reset request.

Parameters:

  • body (schemas.RequestEmail) – The email address of the user requesting the reset.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending the reset email.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

  • jwt_manager (JWTManager) – The JWT manager for generating the reset token.

Returns:

A success message indicating the reset email was sent.

Return type:

dict

app.routers.auth.auth.reset_password(token: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), new_password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_service: UserService = Depends(UserService), jwt_manager: JWTManager = Depends(JWTManager))[source]¶

Reset the user’s password.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The password reset token.

  • new_password (str) – The new password provided by the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_service (UserService) – The user service for interacting with the database.

  • jwt_manager (JWTManager) – The JWT manager for validating tokens.

Returns:

A success message.

Return type:

dict

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The password reset token.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:
